column4: Can someone help me figure out how to keep Ubuntu from changing the screen resolution each time it reboots? I'm using a Dell Optiplex SX270 with Dell 15" LCD 1024x768
what gfx hardware, do you know?
i'm assuming this is the same computer you are on right now, correct?
not the one im chatting on, but it is right next to me
type: ls -l /etc/X11/x*      and tell me if there is an xorg.conf file.
note the case X11 not x11
I see 3 files - xinitrc xinput.d xserverrc
ok, you are going to need to reboot it into recovery mode...
Should I try restarting now to see if the resolution stays the same?
It works, at least for now. Thanks.
